data.title: Very strenuous, don't go during fall
data.text: The way up to the lake is completely uphill. Literally, no flat ground, all up hill. We went during the fall, so it was already a little cooler outside but the river that runs by the hike made it freezing. I made the mistake of not wearing gloves and my fingers were completely numb. I think half the fun of a hike should be walking the trail itself, not just the payoff. Would not recommend.

data.title: Awesome but hard to climb...Huge Moose sighting was great addition to the hike
data.text: This is a hard trail to climb.  You climb up almost 2900 feet elevation to a beautiful lake.  Plan to spend at least 5 hours or more.  There were locals running up the trail, experienced hikers and then there were us tourist who have hiking experience but stopped many time along the way up.

data.title: Strenuos hike, not worth the hype
data.text:
It is one of the toughest hike around the canyons here and one of the highest rated hikes. However, our experience was different. IWe hiked in mid-September, at a time when Utah's reservoirs at their lowest levels. Lake Blanche seemed very shallow and was surrounded by algae. We couldn't locate any waterfall, it had probably dried up.
However, it was about time to spot fall colors on the valley.
It's a strenuous hike and took us about 6 hours to finish. Carry lots of water and food.

data.title: Prepare to be exhausted
data.text: This is rated as a moderate trail and I think that was a bit of an understatement. It took me about 2 hours to make it up and although the view of the lake and surrounding mountains is beautiful it was a grueling trail. The trail itself is about 6.5 miles round trip and very narrow at most places. I did this in the first week of September and the weather couldn't have been better. Make sure to hit this trail if you are passing through the area

data.title: Lake Blanche Trail - Broads Fork Trail #055
data.text: Last weekend, I explored Broads Fork Trail #055. It was as challenging as I had hoped it would be. If you are doing this one for the time and do not normally do serious hiking, make sure you have water, power gels, and "real" hiking boots. I would recommend talking to someone at REI about gear if this is not something you normally do. With that said, it will take you the better part of the day to navigate it round trip. It is an amazing trail. You will not be unhappy if this is the one you choose to hike. Lots of great views.

data.title: Good challenging hike
data.text: This hike requires moderate effort. Nothing terribly steep but it keeps climbing from the trailhead all the way to the lake without much rest. Very defined path that sometimes is narrowed by vegation. There is a little water along the way but nothing that gets you wet.  Just have an idea (map, GPS) of what the 3 lakes look like at the top to make sure you know where you're going.  When the trail runs into the retaining wall at the first lake, make a right and follow the trail along the wall to see the other lakes. If you go left, it will take you on a much longer system of spider web trails around the lakes. It was not terribly crowded on a Saturday afternoon. There is a bathroom at the trailhead but it does not have a sink or place to fill up water bottles. Probably okay for kids accustomed to the altitude and/or hiking because there were no significantly steep parts or big rock climbs.

data.title: Worthy Challenge
data.text: Preface: This was our first hike with backpacks/camping gear so it was a challenge anyway. Even some of the locals claim it is a challenge, though, especially with gear. We took our time going up since we aren't in great shape and probably got up in about 5 hrs or so (you can definitely get up much faster if you stop less, are in better shape or have less gear). There are some seemingly never-ending steep sections so it is not for the faint of heart but if you take your time and enjoy the views it is doable even if you aren't in perfect shape. On the way down, so many people asked us "How much farther?"  I think it took us a little less than 3 hrs to get down the next day. We went in May near Memorial Day and it was pretty busy on Memorial Day. Parking spots can be more challenging to find at peak times.  There is a section of the hike where you have to climb some rocks to continue to the path. They aren't difficult but the pathway isn't especially clear and almost appears to end (some people turned around). But DON'T turn around because it is pretty close to the end. Watch the weather because it can get some good thunderstorms and there were still some snowy spots even in late May. It was cold at night (about 20 degrees) so be prepared if camping. There are three lakes and they are gorgeous. We thought the views up top and along the way were totally worth the journey.

data.title: Difficult hike, but oh so worth it!
data.text: Hiking the Lake Blanche trail was one of the more challenging hikes I have gone on, but the reward when you reach the top is absolutely worth it! STUNNING mountains and lakes!

data.title: often crowded, but a great place to beat the summer heat
data.text: This trail is one of the more popular options in big Cottonwood, and for good reason.  In a relatively short distance, you get to some very beautiful terrain.  People are often surprised at how aerobic the climb is though.  It starts climbing upward and rarely has any flat/rest spots.  And please, if you see moose on the trail (summer through fall), don't go chasing them to get a selfie.  I see this all the time, and somebody is going to be trampled to death.

data.title: Feel like you've landed in a Bob Ross painting
data.text:
This is such a beautiful lake, but it is quite a strenuous hike. It's fairly steep and in the summertime, portions of the trail are exposed to sun, making it pretty hot. 
There will be several times when you think "shouldn't we be there?" 
But it's totally worth it. Bring your camera, because this lake is so picturesque at any time of year. My favorite time is late spring, when it is green, but there is still snow on the surrounding peaks. 
The water is super cold no matter what time of year you go, so swimming will cause a headache, but you can lounge on the flat rocks at the shore, and you really will feel just like Bob Ross has painted all these "happy trees" just for you. :)

data.title: Quite a Strenuous Trail, but Worth It!
data.text: A few friends and I hiked Lake Blanche in October and it was fabulous. We are in great shape and made it round trip in ~4 hours. It is quite strenuous and required some big steps up some rocks. The end is worth it as you end up at a beautiful secluded lake high in the mountains. The scenery was beautiful the entire way. It was not too crowded when we went. Make sure to pack plenty of water and snacks.

data.title: One of best trails I have ever hiked!
data.text: This is a strenuous hike and so make sure you are in shape. Total time to allow is 5 hours min if you want to spend some time relaxing at the top. Add another hour if you want to another mile to the other 2 lakes up here. Spectacular view of a watershed lake and just a great trail and views the entire way. Next time I am going to bring a fishing rod for sure. This is a must do trail if you are a serious hiker and visiting SLC!

data.title: Beautiful scenery
data.text: The Lake Blanche trail features very beautiful scenary. As you gradually climb the vegetation and scenery also changes. Nice place for fall colors. I found the lake(s) less impressive than the trail.

data.title: Beautiful hike to several great lakes and a variety of great scenery
data.text: Lake Blanche trail is one of the best hikes near to Salt Lake City. Presently on the TA the name is misspelled and the location is not in town. The trailhead is in Big Cottonwood Canyon, at Mill B, at about the 6 miles, before a double switch back. The trailhead is well marked and so is the trail. It is about 6 miles long and has beautiful view, the forest, and then the valley of Salt Lake and it keeps climbing until you reach Lake Blanche. It is a beautiful semi-natural lake nested among great peaks. There are two additional lakes after the dam.

data.title: Dont miss lake Blanche, the pyramid peak above the lake is awesome at sunset
data.text: Make no mistake,  this is a long hike but the rewarding views make it well worth the big climb. There is a pyramid shaped mountain looming over Lake Blanche that is unbelievably majestic in the low angle light as the sun is setting.  Be careful not to stay too long admiring and photographing the lake and pyramid, because it is a 2 hour hike back to the car parking area.

data.title: Lake Blanche
data.text: This hike is located in the center of the Twin Peaks Wilderness Area, Lake Blanche is a great activity for weekend hikers. A well-maintained trail climbs through beautiful canyon scenery to a photogenic basin containing Lake Blanche, Lake Florence and Lake Lillian.

data.title: Bonito paisaje!
data.text: Es uno de los mejores trails en los que he estado. Es muy cansado el camino aunque pasas por diferentes escenarios y tiene vistas espectaculares! Altamente recomendado si llevas agua y comida ;)

data.title: Маршрут к озеру
data.text: Одно из красивейших озер данной местности - озеро Бланш. Путь к нему сложноватый, но стоит потратить его дабы насладиться его красотой и видом на противоположный берег ( горная местность на противоположной стороне)
